title: TNT (American TV network)
summary: TNT (originally an abbreviation for Turner Network Television) is an American basic cable television channel owned by WarnerMedia Studios & Networks that launched in October 1988.[4] TNT's original purpose was to air classic films and television series to which Turner Broadcasting maintained spillover rights through its sister channel SuperStation TBS (now simply TBS). Since June 2001, the network had shifted its focus to dramatic television series and feature films, along with some sporting events (including NBA and NHL games, the NCAA Division I Men's Basketball Tournament, as well as professional wrestling from All Elite Wrestling).
